results.title: A Partial List of Mass Shootings in the United States in 2022
results.abstract: The attack at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, in which 19 children, a teacher and another adult were killed, was the country’s deadliest shooting this year.

media.caption: At a memorial outside the Tops supermarket in Buffalo where a gunman killed 10 people on May 14.

results.title: Indiana Lawmakers Override Transgender Sports Veto
results.abstract: Gov. Eric Holcomb said the measure barring transgender girls from playing girls’ sports at school was unnecessary, but fellow Republicans in the Legislature disagreed.

media.caption: A rally for transgender rights at the Indiana Statehouse on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Casey Smith/Report for America, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Coronavirus Omicron Variant;Vaccination and Immunization;Jha, Ashish (1970- );Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;New York City
results.title: Another Omicron subvariant, known as BA.2.12.1, has become the dominant form among new U.S. virus cases.
results.abstract: The development comes as the United States recently began averaging more than 100,000 new confirmed cases per day again, according to a New York Times database, for the first time since February.

media.caption: Getting tested for the coronavirus in Syracuse, N.Y., earlier this month.

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;United States Politics and Government;Presidents and Presidency (US);Biden, Joseph R Jr;Taiwan;China
results.title: Biden Veers Off Script on Taiwan. It’s Not the First Time.
results.abstract: Offhand remarks that vary from the official talking points have become a feature of the Biden presidency, even as they leave his staff scrambling to spin them away afterward.

media.caption: President Biden’s improvisation in Tokyo stirred a mix of reactions back in Washington.

results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Police Reform;Police;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;United States Politics and Government;Executive Orders and Memorandums;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Justice Department
results.byline: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Charlie Savage
results.title: Biden Set to Issue Policing Order on Anniversary of Floyd Killing
results.abstract: The order would direct all federal agencies to revise their use-of-force policies and create a national registry of officers fired for misconduct.

media.caption: President Biden and Jill Biden, the first lady, at a ceremony in early May for law enforcement officers who died in the line of duty. The president is expected to sign a new executive order that creates a database of officers who have been fired due to misconduct.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Baptist Churches;Southern Baptist Convention
results.title: Southern Baptists to Release List of Ministers Accused of Sexual Abuse
results.abstract: The existence of the secretly maintained list was revealed in a bombshell report on the denomination’s handling of sexual abuse over the past two decades.

media.caption: Southern Baptists will convene for their annual meeting in mid-June and will consider the report’s findings and recommendations.

results.adx_keywords: Shoplifting and Employee Theft (Retail);Self-Defense;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Dunn, Michael C (1971- );Lopez, Christobal (d 2018);Florida;Lakeland (Fla);Polk County (Fla)
results.title: Ex-City Official in Florida Is Sentenced to 3 Years for Killing a Shoplifter
results.abstract: The former commissioner, Michael Dunn, 51, of Lakeland, Fla., had pleaded guilty to manslaughter after shooting a man he had suspected of stealing a hatchet in his store in 2018.

media.caption: Michael Dunn, holding a gun, struggled with Cristobal Lopez before fatally shooting him at the Vets Army Navy Surplus store in Lakeland, Fla.

results.title: Help! The Airline Changed My Flight Itinerary (for the Worse)
results.abstract: Airlines are within their contractual rights to cancel booked flights and place passengers on less-convenient routes with hours-long layovers. Our columnist investigates whether travelers have any recourse.

results.title: The Suspect in a Fatal Subway Shooting Is in Police Custody

results.abstract: The coordinated bomber flights were the first training activity the two nations had done together since President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

media.caption: President Biden with, from left, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese of Australia, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida of Japan and Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India in Tokyo on Tuesday.

results.byline: By Robert Gebeloff and Jacey Fortin
results.title: Uvalde, Texas, is a small city not far from the U.S. southern border.
results.abstract: The city of about 15,200 people is in a region with a large Mexican American population.

media.caption: Anguish outside the Civic Center in Uvalde, Texas, where students were transported after a shooting at Robb Elementary School on Tuesday.

results.title: He Won the Lottery for an Affordable Apartment, After Years of Trying
results.abstract: Josh Bianchi visited New York City from Michigan in the fourth grade, and he was hooked. Then he found out how difficult it could be to live in the city.
org_facet: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)

media.caption: Josh Bianchi, 30, spent years applying to affordable housing lotteries while cycling through Craigslist rentals. This winter, he found his golden ticket.

results.title: As Monkeypox Cases Rise, Nations Are Urged to Examine Vaccine Stores
results.abstract: The United States has stockpiled millions of doses of two smallpox vaccines, also effective against monkeypox. But the outbreaks so far are clustered in other countries.

results.title: A Tactical Disaster for Russia’s Military

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Marriages;Celebrities;Social Media;Kardashian, Kourtney (1979- );DOLCE & GABBANA;Portofino (Italy)
results.byline: By Vanessa Friedman and Jessica Testa
results.title: The Branded Marriage of Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker
results.abstract: The latest wedding in the family became a walking ad for Dolce & Gabbana. Is this a new model for celebrity matrimony?

media.caption: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker after their wedding ceremony in Portofino. They both wore Dolce & Gabbana: she in a corseted mini (accented with tulle gloves) and he in a tuxedo (with a golden cross brooch).
